Results:
Test A: Out of the 27 respondents 92.6% of survey results indicate that difficulties arose when attempting to rock climb.
Test B: Another survey concluded that 100% of the 27 of the 32 respondents felt their restrictive capabilities impaired their enjoyment of this sport.
Evaluation: This demonstrates that visually challenged individuals' face restrictions when rock climbing, additionally the enjoyment of this sport is affected due to their vision impairment. Establishing rock climbing's ineffective ability to be accessible to vision impaired people.
